attributes.action: replace the current road pricing strategies with a homogonous "catch all, pay as you use system"
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In addition to moving road tax and third party insurance to fuel duty, and to ensure a fair spread of costs and encourage good driving practices, a sliding scale of fuel costs should be implemented.
This can take the form of a compulsory fuel card system, whereby road users who cause accidents, incur traffic offences, and consume more fuel pay a higher price per unit of fuel than those who drive safer and use less fuel.
This way each person has a personal fuel pricing value.
This will encourage good vehicle usage, limit damage to environment, collect otherwise lost revenue, eradicate evaders, and remove problem of un-insured losses.
